snippet: While Washington and Europe praise Turkey as the model of Muslim democracy for the Arab world, human rights advocates say the government is curbing press freedom.
abstract: Human rights advocates say the Turkish government is curbing press freedom, despite fact that Washington and Europe praise country as the model of Muslim democracy for the Arab world; 13 defendants, mostly journalists who exposed government corruption, appear in Istanbul court on charges related to abetting a terrorist organization.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and SEBNEM ARSU

lead_paragraph: While Washington and Europe praise Turkey as the model of Muslim democracy for the Arab world, human rights advocates say the government is curbing press freedom.

headline.seo: Turkey’s Glow Dims as Government Limits Free Speech
headline.main: Charges Against Journalists Dim the Democratic Glow in Turkey
headline.print_headline: Charges Against Journalists Dim the Democratic Glow in Turkey
